permutations.name: passage-rfc2119
permutations.text: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

permutations.name: passage-3rdPartyExtensions
permutations.text:
Thousands of third-party modules and themes are available from these sources:
  • DNN Store: Extensions for sale. Some developers provide versions that include the source code.
  • DNN Forge: Open source and free extensions.

permutations.name: passage-ul-publisheddatespages
permutations.text:
• The page is published after the specified start date. If Start Date is not set, the page is published immediately.
  • The page is hidden after the specified end date. If End Date is not set, the page is visible indefinitely.

permutations.name: passage-ul-publisheddatesmodules
permutations.text:
• The module is published after the specified start date. If Start Date is not set, the module is published immediately.
  • The module is hidden after the specified end date. If End Date is not set, the module is visible indefinitely.

permutations.name: passage-fieldadd
permutations.text: To add a new field, drag and drop a field type to the canvas, then configure its settings.

permutations.name: passage-fieldedit
permutations.text: To edit a field, click/tap on the field in the canvas, then configure its settings.

permutations.name: passage-fielddup
permutations.text: To duplicate a field, hover over the field in the canvas, click/tap the duplicate icon, then configure the settings of the new copy.

permutations.name: passage-fielddel
permutations.text: To delete a field, hover over the field in the canvas, and click/tap the trash icon.

permutations.name: passage-oldterm
permutations.text: This is the old term, still used in some APIs and UI controls.

permutations.name: passage-pbar-varies
permutations.text: The Persona Bar varies according to the product and to the permissions granted to the current authenticated (logged-in) user through roles. Examples: A host or superuser has access to almost all menu items, whereas a community manager would have access to only the features required to manage the community-related aspects of the site. Likewise, Evoq Content does not have the community-related menu items that Evoq Engage has.

permutations.name: passage-selectfilebox
permutations.text:
You can use one of the following methods to select the file:
  • Drag and drop the file to the box.
  • Select from the files in your site folder.
  • Upload a file.
  • Link to a file.
